result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert E Dobbins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $250 DNA surcharge remitted. $268  to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervison or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.
Maintain full-time employment/education or combination of or be seeking same, and treatment.
Do not drive a motor vehicle without valid DL and approval of agent.
Court finds defendant eligible for expunction under 973.015 provided def completes probation w/ no ATR's, no revocations & no new charges.
Random UA & BA testing at discretion of agent.  Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert E Dobbins

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

Reporter:  Jeanette Sundstrom; Atty Eisenberg has received copy of information & waives reading;  Court entered not guilty plea for defendant. Motions due 20 days. Bail continued.
and Notice of DNA and Witness List (Plaintiff's)

Reporter: Melanie Nelson
Witness JW duly sworn and testifies.  Direct by ADA Glinberg, Cross by Atty Eisenberg.  State moves for bind over.  No arguments by defn.  Ct finds probable cause.
Preliminary hearing on April 29, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant in court with Attorney Mark Arthur Eisenberg.  Erin Hanson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 29, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on March 31, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release.
- Defendant shall not be at or around Hazelwood court.
- Defendant shall not use or possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription.
  - Defendant shall not be at or around Capitol Petro on Rimrock Road, Madison.
  - Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Jarrell J.
  Defendant waived the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Trial judge -  Br 12.  Status conference scheduled for 03-31-2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant in court with Attorney Mark Arthur Eisenberg.  Jordan Lippert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.  Defendant stood mute.  Court entered not guilty plea as to any misdemeanor counts.

- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Jarrell J.
- Defendant shall not be on Hazelwood Ct in Madison, WI.
- Defendant shall not use or possess any controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription.
